titleStmt.title: A brief discourse of the real presence of the body and blood of Christ in the celebration of the Holy Eucharist wherein the witty artifices of the Bishop of Meaux and of Monsieur Maimbourg are obviated, whereby they would draw in the Protestants to imbrace the doctrine of transubstantiation.
titleStmt.author: More, Henry, 1614-1687.
Wake, William, 1657-1737.

notesStmt.note: Attributed to Henry More, and also to William Wake--NUC pre-1956 imprints.
Reproduction of original in the Huntington Library.
